definition: to force/to compel/to approach or go towards/urgent/pressing
to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger

sentences.english: Air whips past the blades of a turbine, forcing it to spin.
sentences.chinese: 經過風輪葉片的空氣迫使風輪旋轉，風輪驅動電機。

sentences.english: Flooding forced the closure of manufacturing plants in Ayutthaya, according to news reports.
sentences.chinese: 據新聞報道，洪水已迫使大城府的製造工廠關閉。

sentences.english: The unfinalizability of dialogue forces reader to find the truth of the Sutpen s tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 對話的未終結性迫使讀者參與到找出真相的活動中來。

sentences.english: He drove the workers until they collapsed.
sentences.chinese: 他迫使工人們幹得一個個累趴在地。

sentences.english: The new engine uses turbocharging, which forces air through it.
sentences.chinese: 新發動機採用了渦輪增壓技術，迫使空氣進入發動機。

sentences.english: He had made up his mind that Johnson was guilty, and he steamrollered anyone who disagree with him.
sentences.chinese: 他已經認定約翰遜有罪，並迫使任何持異議者就範。

sentences.english: He was also accused of forcing buyers to purchase water-injected meat.
sentences.chinese: 他還被指控迫使買家購買注水肉。

sentences.english: Protesters in August forced the closing of a chemical plant in Dalian.
sentences.chinese: 八月，抗議者們迫使大連一家化工廠關閉。

sentences.english: Fixing the boy with a steady look,the teacher forced him to tell the truth.
sentences.chinese: 老師的目光緊緊盯着學生，迫使他說出了真情。

sentences.english: It also forced France's express train operator to cut about half of its services.
sentences.chinese: 罷工還迫使法國的高速鐵路把車次減半。

sentences.english: You either settle for the outside shot or you pass to your teammates.
sentences.chinese: 他們迫使你選擇傳球或外線投籃。

sentences.english: Is your tight work schedule forcing you to forego your daily exercises?
sentences.chinese: 你滿滿的工作安排是否迫使你放棄日常鍛鍊？

sentences.english: The anticipated increase in sample numbers necessitates innovative technology solutions to achieve success.
sentences.chinese: 預期樣本數的增加迫使技術革新以取得成功。

sentences.english: You can force some or all connections off from a database.
sentences.chinese: 可以迫使某些或所有應用程序斷開與數據庫的連接。

sentences.english: Being unshakable means not letting people and other situations get a reaction from you.
sentences.chinese: 變得不可動搖意味着別讓人和別的情況迫使你迴應。

definition: to induce/to promote/to urge/to impel/to bring about/to provoke/to drive (sb to do sth)/to catalyze/to actuate/to contribute to (some development)
to act against one's will/to have no alternative but to/to have to/to have no choice/must
to seize an opportunity/to take advantage of situation
constrained/restricted/forced to/under pressure to do sth
to do sth by force/Taiwan pr. [qiang3 xing2]
to turn to (sth else)/to switch to
to lure into/to entrap/to trick into/to entice/to induce/to invite/to tempt
